result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan M Poland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:35 a.m. TAPE RECORDED: Defendant Samuel A Pientka in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. ADA Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed and waived reading.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  Community service and AODA completed. Cts 1 & 2 $100 fine + cost + DNA surcharges.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Amended Ct 1 & count 2: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty amended count 1 and count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
  Count 3 is dismissed and read-in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing statements.
Atty Barkley concurs with recommendations.

BY THE COURT:*****
Amended Count 1: $100 fine + cost + DNA surcharges
Count 2: $100 fine + cost + DNA surcharges
END TAPE RECORD: 10:53

Defendant Evan M Poland in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for Attorney to Appear and Act

2:41 p.m. Defendant Evan M Poland in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived.
Atty Barkley request Defendant has a vehicle at the sheriff's Department and would like his work related items that he needs.  ADA Constable states that Atty Barkley provide the state with further information.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Jonathan Tomczak. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.

ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Atty Jerod Barkley appears in Court. 

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of Substantial Battery, Possession of THC, Possess Drug Paraphernalia.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  7/13/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
